We take our Zoom songwriting sessions very seriously 🤣 Young person Jennifer (who is now writing her 2nd lockdown song 🥳💪) said recently "with Ensemble it’s so much better because you’re not having as much anxiety, like at work or with lockdown, you’re not so alone."❤️ https://t.co/aMoqmkZXqm

2021-02-25.text: Our next single 'Battlefield' by Andrew Sinclair, ,  will be released 26.03.21 🤩🎉🥳 Andrew says "To me this song is about when I joined Ensemble... taking a risk, going into the unknown... I was homeless at the time but I found that place to call home"❤️ https://t.co/ZL1KpaEqzy

2021-02-24.text: Happy faces after listening to the 1st full draft of young person Jennifer's new song this morning 🤩 She says: "My new song means a lot. It’s about my work in care, but it’s also about me and everybody at work. It gets lonely sometimes but it’s not as lonely with the song"🥰 https://t.co/IxGs3MBUmy

2021-02-23.text: Thanks to  &  for allowing us to continue to deliver this unique opportunity to young people ❤️🙏 Beautiful drawing of the lighthouse is by Jennifer Pollock who is currently writing a song with   inspired by lighthouses! 🤩

Even the virus pandemic is much less than some of the things people have been through individually. But we are all there for each other making music and writing songs and sharing our stories and listening the best we can when we can’t meet up in person like we did before."

Ensemble is honestly a whole different kettle of fish, it is completely different to every other thing I have ever been involved with. There are so many people from all different backgrounds who have been through all different things, sometimes really dark...

Even when it seemed most black, there were these evenings and we could meet up and share songs we were working on. No matter what’s going on in the day or what I’ve been feeling like, I can come and have a much nicer time. It’s a nice space, no pressure for anything...

Heartwarming feedback (thread) from one of our young people recently ❤️

"Ensemble’s been a beacon in the dark of this pandemic. I really do feel that. It isn’t just a meeting on zoom, it is a connection, trying to make something good out of a very odd situation... https://t.co/8dfpVpdsAS

2021-02-09.text: It was so lovely to reconnect in our first big group get together of 2021 last week 🥳 We were able to listen back to 5 brand new Ensemble songs written by our young people and musicians 🥰 They are all AMAZING. Those who couldn't be there, we missed you very much! https://t.co/TTBu5akG1u

2020-12-11.text: Powerful words about today's single release by young person  who co-wrote it with the help of professional musicians   and her keyworker at the time Tony McNamee. We are so proud of you Steph! 🙌❤️ https://t.co/4f17eylGxg
Thank you so much to  and  for providing our young people with the opportunity to create and release new music!  🙏❤️

...and I was diagnosed with anxiety so everything was very overwhelming. Being able to write this song for my brother was really special to me. He deals with a lot, so if he ever needs me, no matter where I am or what time it is, he can listen to it and not be alone."

Young person Steph McCrystal says about the song: 

"‘Nightlight is a story about me and my brother. We grew up in an abusive household and it talks about the troubles we had together. When I wrote the song I was in a homeless unit, my life was all over the place...
